result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sandro Perez Cervantes

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sandro Perez Cervantes in court in custody with attorney Erik I. Colque and sworn interpreter Victor Gonzalez.  Anne Theresa Nack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case dismissed and read in.

Defendant Sandro Perez Cervantes in court in custody with attorney Valerie A. Zisman and sworn interpreter Victor Gonzalez.  Gwanny J. Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Sandro Perez Cervantes in court in custody with attorney Sean Drury.  Anne Theresa Nack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Sandro Perez Cervantes in court in custody with attorney Ashley Jade Morse.  Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Absolute sobriety.  Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case.
